newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France drains 1.9 bln Ffr at tender.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France drains 1.9 bln Ffr at tender.

text.p: The Bank of France drained 1.9 billion francs at a securities repurchase tender held on Tuesday to allocate funds for injection into the money market the same day.
It accepted bids for 39.1 billion francs in new liquidity, 1.9 billion less than the 41.0 billion leaving the market on Tuesday when a previous pact expires. The new pact expires on April 8.
The Bank of France said it allocated 11.6 billion francs to bidders offering Treasury bills as collateral, satisfying 3.9 percent of such demand.
It allotted a further 27.5 billion to bidders putting up private paper, satisfying 11.5 percent of this demand.
The central bank announced earlier on Tuesday the interest rate used at the tender, the intervention rate, would be unchanged at 3.10 percent.
